sentences.zh: 太史公曰：余每讀虞書，至於君臣相敕，維是几安，而股肱不良，萬事墮壞，未嘗不流涕也。

translations.text: The Grand Historian said: Whenever I read the Book of Yu, I cannot help but weep when I reach the passage where ruler and minister admonish each other to maintain stability, yet if the limbs are unfit, all affairs decline and collapse.

sentences.zh: 成王作頌，推己懲艾，悲彼家難，可不謂戰戰恐懼，善守善終哉？

translations.text: King Cheng composed the Odes, examining himself to correct his faults, grieving the misfortunes of his family—can this not be called trembling with fear, skilled at guarding and completing well?

sentences.zh: 君子不為約則修德，滿則棄禮，佚能思初，安能惟始，沐浴膏澤而歌詠勤苦，非大德誰能如斯！

translations.text: The gentleman cultivates virtue in poverty, abandons ritual when full; in leisure he thinks of beginnings, in peace he remembers origins; bathing in rich favors yet singing of hardships—who but one of great virtue could be like this!

sentences.zh: 傳曰「治定功成，禮樂乃興」。

translations.text: The tradition says: 'When order is established and merit achieved, rites and music then flourish.'

sentences.zh: 海內人道益深，其德益至，所樂者益異。

translations.text: Within the empire, human relationships grow deeper, virtue grows more perfect, and what people delight in grows more refined.

sentences.zh: 滿而不損則溢，盈而不持則傾。

translations.text: When full without diminishing, it overflows; when replete without holding, it topples.

sentences.zh: 凡作樂者，所以節樂。

translations.text: All who make music do so in order to regulate pleasure.

sentences.zh: 君子以謙退為禮，以損減為樂，樂其如此也。

translations.text: The gentleman takes humility and withdrawal as ritual, takes moderation as music, and delights in it being thus.

sentences.zh: 以為州異國殊，情習不同，故博采風俗，協比聲律，以補短移化，助流政教。

translations.text: Considering that provinces differ and states are distinct, that feelings and customs are not the same, thus broadly gathering local customs, coordinating and comparing tones and melodies, to supplement deficiencies and shift transformations, assist in flowing governance and education.

sentences.zh: 天子躬於明堂臨觀，而萬民咸蕩滌邪穢，斟酌飽滿，以飾厥性。

translations.text: The Son of Heaven personally at the Bright Hall oversees and observes, while all the people wash away evil impurities, measuring what is appropriate and full, to adorn their nature.

sentences.zh: 故云雅頌之音理而民正，嘄噭之聲興而士奮，鄭衛之曲動而心淫。

translations.text: Thus it is said that ya and song sounds when well-ordered then people are correct, clear and loud sounds when arise then scholars are aroused, Zheng and Wei tunes when move then hearts become licentious.

sentences.zh: 及其調和諧合，鳥獸盡感，而況懷五常，含好惡，自然之勢也？

translations.text: When it reaches harmonious blending, birds and beasts are all affected, and moreover those embracing the five constants, containing likes and dislikes—is this not the natural tendency?

The Grand Historian said: Whenever I read the Yu Shu, coming to where ruler and minister mutually admonish, only thus securing stability, yet if the limbs are not good, all affairs decline and collapse, I never fail to shed tears. King Cheng made the Odes, reflecting on himself to punish and correct, grieving the family difficulties—can this not be called trembling in fear, good at guarding and good at completing? The gentleman when in poverty then cultivates virtue, when full then abandons ritual, in leisure able to think of beginnings, in peace able to remember origins, bathing in rich favor yet singing of hardships, who but great virtue could be like this! The tradition says 'When governance is settled and merit complete, rites and music then flourish'. Within the seas human ways grow deeper, their virtue grows more perfect, what they delight in grows more refined. Full without diminishing then overflows, replete without holding then topples. All who make music do so in order to regulate joy. The gentleman takes humility and withdrawal as ritual, takes diminishing as music, delights in it being thus. Considering that provinces differ and states are distinct, feelings and customs are not the same, thus broadly gathering customs, coordinating and comparing tones and melodies, to supplement deficiencies and shift transformations, assist in flowing governance and teaching. The Son of Heaven personally at the Bright Hall oversees and observes, while the myriad people all wash away evil impurities, measuring fullness, to adorn their nature. Thus it is said that ya and song sounds when well-ordered then people are correct, clear and loud sounds when arise then scholars are aroused, Zheng and Wei tunes when move then hearts become licentious. When it reaches harmonious blending, birds and beasts are all affected, and moreover those embracing the five constants, containing likes and dislikes, is the natural tendency?

sentences.zh: 治道虧缺而鄭音興起，封君世辟，名顯鄰州，爭以相高。

translations.text: When the way of governance is deficient, Zheng sounds arise; feudal lords with hereditary officials, names illustrious in neighboring provinces, contend to outdo each other.

sentences.zh: 自仲尼不能與齊優遂容於魯，雖退正樂以誘世，作五章以剌時，猶莫之化。

translations.text: Since Confucius could not tolerate the Qi actor Su in Lu, though he withdrew to correct music to guide the age, made five chapters to criticize the times, still none were transformed.

sentences.zh: 陵遲以至六國，流沔沈佚，遂往不返，卒於喪身滅宗，并國於秦。

translations.text: Declining until the six states, flowing and sinking into dissipation, going without return, finally losing life and destroying clan, states annexed by Qin.

The way of governance deficient and Zheng sounds arise, feudal lords hereditary officials, names illustrious in neighboring provinces, contend to outdo each other. Since Confucius could not tolerate the Qi actor Su in Lu, though he withdrew to correct music to guide the age, made five chapters to criticize the times, still none were transformed. Declining until the six states, flowing and sinking into dissipation, going without return, finally losing life and destroying clan, states annexed by Qin.

sentences.zh: 秦二世尤以為娛。

translations.text: Qin Ershi especially took it as entertainment.

sentences.zh: 丞相李斯進諫曰：「放棄詩書，極意聲色，祖伊所以懼也；

translations.text: Chancellor Li Si advanced remonstrance saying: 'Abandoning poetry and books, exhausting intent on sounds and colors—this is what Zu Yi feared;

sentences.zh: 輕積細過，恣心長夜，紂所以亡也。」

translations.text: lightly accumulating small errors, indulging heart in long nights—this is why Zhou perished.'

sentences.zh: 趙高曰：「五帝、三王樂各殊名，示不相襲。

translations.text: Zhao Gao said: 'The five emperors and three kings' music each had different names, showing they did not copy each other.

sentences.zh: 上自朝廷，下至人民，得以接歡喜，合殷勤，非此和說不通，解澤不流，亦各一世之化，度時之樂，何必華山之騄耳而後行遠乎？」

translations.text: Above from the court, below to the people, able to connect happiness and joy, unite diligence and care; without this harmonious delight does not penetrate, grace and favor does not flow; each is one age's transformation, timely music—why must it be Huashan swift horses before going far?'

sentences.zh: 二世然之。

translations.text: Ershi approved this.

sentences.zh: 高祖過沛詩三侯之章，令小兒歌之。

translations.text: Gaozu passed through Pei, sang the 'Three Marquis of Pei' poem, ordered children to sing it.

sentences.zh: 高祖崩，令沛得以四時歌儛宗廟。

translations.text: Gaozu passed away, ordered Pei to be able to sing and dance at the ancestral temple in the four seasons.

sentences.zh: 孝惠、孝文、孝景無所增更，於樂府習常肄舊而已。

translations.text: Filial Hui, Filial Wen, Filial Jing made no additions or changes; at the Music Bureau they only practiced the constant and rehearsed the old.

Gaozu passed through Pei, sang the 'Three Marquis of Pei' poem, ordered children to sing it. Gaozu passed away, ordered Pei to be able to sing and dance at the ancestral temple in the four seasons. Filial Hui, Filial Wen, Filial Jing made no additions or changes, at the Music Bureau only practiced the constant and rehearsed the old.

sentences.zh: 至今上即位，作十九章，令侍中李延年次序其聲，拜為協律都尉。

translations.text: Until the present emperor ascended, made nineteen chapters, ordered Attendant in Emperor's Presence Li Yannian to arrange their sounds, appointed as Harmonizing Pitch Chief Commandant.

sentences.zh: 通一經之士不能獨知其辭，皆集會五經家，相與共講習讀之，乃能通知其意，多爾雅之文。

translations.text: Those who master one classic cannot alone know their words; all gather the five classics scholars, mutually discuss and study read them, then can fully understand their meaning—much elegant and correct literature.

Until the present emperor ascended, made nineteen chapters, ordered Attendant in Emperor's Presence Li Yannian to arrange their sounds, appointed as Harmonizing Pitch Chief Commandant. Those who master one classic cannot alone know their words, all gather the five classics scholars, mutually discuss and study read them, then can fully understand their meaning, much elegant and correct literature.

sentences.zh: 漢家常以正月上辛祠太一甘泉，以昏時夜祠，到明而終。

translations.text: The Han house constantly in the first month upper xin sacrifices Taiyi at Ganquan, sacrifices at night dusk time, until dawn ends.

sentences.zh: 常有流星經於祠壇上。

translations.text: Constantly has shooting stars passing over the sacrifice altar.

sentences.zh: 使僮男僮女七十人俱歌。

translations.text: Makes young boys and girls seventy people all sing together.

sentences.zh: 春歌青陽，夏歌朱明，秋歌西暤，冬歌玄冥。

translations.text: Spring sings Qingyang, summer sings Zhuming, autumn sings Xihao, winter sings Xuanming.

sentences.zh: 世多有，故不論。

translations.text: The world has many such, thus not discussed.

The Han house constantly in the first month upper xin sacrifices Taiyi at Ganquan, sacrifices at night dusk time, until dawn ends. Constantly has shooting stars passing over the sacrifice altar. Makes young boys and girls seventy people all sing together. Spring sings Qingyang, summer sings Zhuming, autumn sings Xihao, winter sings Xuanming. The world has many such, thus not discussed.

sentences.zh: 又嘗得神馬渥洼水中，復次以為太一之歌。

translations.text: Also once obtained divine horse in Wo Wo waters, moreover composed as Taiyi song.

sentences.zh: 歌曲曰：「太一貢兮天馬下，霑赤汗兮沫流赭。

translations.text: The song lyrics say: 'Taiyi contributes, heavenly horse descends; stained red sweat, froth flows crimson.

sentences.zh: 騁容與兮跇萬里，今安匹兮龍為友。」

translations.text: Gallop leisurely, stride ten thousand li; now peacefully matched, dragon as friend.'

sentences.zh: 後伐大宛得千里馬，馬名蒲梢，次作以為歌。

translations.text: Later conquered Dawan obtained thousand li horse, horse named Pu Shao, moreover composed as song.

sentences.zh: 歌詩曰：「天馬來兮從西極，經萬里兮歸有德。

translations.text: Song poem says: 'Heavenly horse comes from western extreme; traverses ten thousand li, returns to virtuous.

sentences.zh: 承靈威兮降外國，涉流沙兮四夷服。」

translations.text: Receives spiritual might, descends foreign states; crosses flowing sands, four barbarians submit.'

sentences.zh: 中尉汲黯進曰：「凡王者作樂，上以承祖宗，下以化兆民。

translations.text: Commandant Ji An advanced saying: 'All who make music: above to receive ancestors, below to transform the myriad people.

sentences.zh: 今陛下得馬，詩以為歌，協於宗廟，先帝百姓豈能知其音邪？」

translations.text: Now Your Majesty obtains horse, makes poem into song, harmonious at ancestral temple—former emperors and common people, how can they know its sound?'

sentences.zh: 上默然不說。

translations.text: The emperor was silently displeased.

sentences.zh: 丞相公孫弘曰：「黯誹謗聖制，當族。」

translations.text: Chancellor Gongsun Hong said: 'An slanders and defames the sage's system, should be exterminated.'

sentences.zh: 凡音之起，由人心生也。

translations.text: All sounds arise from human heart born.

sentences.zh: 人心之動，物使之然也。

translations.text: Human heart's movement, things cause it thus.

sentences.zh: 感於物而動，故形於聲；

translations.text: Affected by things and move, thus take form in sound;

sentences.zh: 聲相應，故生變；

translations.text: sounds respond each other, thus produce change;

sentences.zh: 變成方，謂之音；

translations.text: change becomes pattern, called tone;

sentences.zh: 比音而樂之，及干戚羽旄，謂之樂也。

translations.text: compare tones and delight in them, with shields axes feathers banners, called music.

sentences.zh: 樂者，音之所由生也，其本在人心感於物也。

translations.text: Music is what sound is born from; its root is human heart affected by things.

sentences.zh: 是故其哀心感者，其聲噍以殺；

translations.text: Thus those whose grieving heart is affected, their sound urgent and subdued;

sentences.zh: 其樂心感者，其聲啴以緩；

translations.text: Those whose joyful heart is affected, their sound broad and slow;

sentences.zh: 其喜心感者，其聲發以散；

translations.text: Those whose joyful hearts are moved produce sounds that issue forth and disperse;

sentences.zh: 其怒心感者，其聲麤以厲；

translations.text: Those whose angry hearts are moved produce sounds that are coarse and fierce;

sentences.zh: 其敬心感者，其聲直以廉；

translations.text: Those whose respectful hearts are moved produce sounds that are straight and upright;

sentences.zh: 其愛心感者，其聲和以柔。

translations.text: Those whose loving hearts are moved produce sounds that are harmonious and soft.

sentences.zh: 六者非性也，感於物而後動，是故先王慎所以感之。

translations.text: These six are not innate human nature; they arise from external stimuli. Therefore, the former kings were careful about what could affect people.

sentences.zh: 故禮以導其志，樂以和其聲，政以壹其行，刑以防其姦。

translations.text: Thus ritual guides the will, music harmonizes the voice, governance unites conduct, and punishments guard against evil.

sentences.zh: 禮樂刑政，其極一也，所以同民心而出治道也。

translations.text: Ritual, music, punishments, and governance all share one ultimate principle: to unite people's hearts and establish the way of governance.

All sounds arise from human heart born. Human heart's movement, things cause it thus. Affected by things and move, thus take form in sound; Sounds respond each other, thus produce change; Change becomes pattern, called tone; Compare tones and delight in them, with shields axes feathers banners, called music. Music is what sound is born from, its root is human heart affected by things. Thus those whose grieving heart is affected, their sound urgent and subdued; Those whose joyful heart is affected, their sound broad and slow; Those whose joyful heart is affected, their sound issuing and dispersing; Those whose angry heart is affected, their sound coarse and fierce; Those whose respectful heart is affected, their sound straight and upright; Those whose loving heart is affected, their sound harmonious and soft. These six are not nature, affected by things then move, thus former kings careful about what affects them. Thus ritual guides their will, music harmonizes their sound, governance unites their conduct, punishments guard their evil. Ritual music punishments governance, their ultimate is one, what unites people's hearts and brings forth governance way.

sentences.zh: 凡音者，生人心者也。

translations.text: All sounds originate from the human heart.

sentences.zh: 情動於中，故形於聲，聲成文謂之音。

translations.text: Emotions move within us, taking form as sound; sounds form patterns, which are called tones.

sentences.zh: 是故治世之音安以樂，其正和；

translations.text: Thus in well-governed ages, sounds are peaceful and joyful, their harmony correct. In chaotic ages, sounds are resentful and angry, their harmony perverse. In fallen states, sounds are mournful and anxious, their people distressed.

sentences.zh: 亂世之音怨以怒，其正乖；

translations.text: The way of sound connects with what is correct.

sentences.zh: 亡國之音哀以思，其民困。

translations.text: Gong represents the ruler, shang represents ministers, jue represents the people, zhi represents affairs, yu represents things.

sentences.zh: 聲音之道，與正通矣。

translations.text: When these five are not in disorder, there are no melancholic sounds.

sentences.zh: 宮為君，商為臣，角為民，徵為事，羽為物。

translations.text: When gong is disordered, it becomes wild—its ruler arrogant. When shang is disordered, it becomes harsh—its ministers ruined. When jue is disordered, it becomes worried—its people resentful. When zhi is disordered, it becomes mournful—its affairs laborious. When yu is disordered, it becomes dangerous—its wealth depleted.

sentences.zh: 五者不亂，則無惉懘之音矣。

translations.text: When all five are disordered and mutually encroaching, it is called laxity.

sentences.zh: 宮亂則荒，其君驕；

translations.text: Thus the state's extinction comes without warning.

sentences.zh: 商亂則搥，其臣壞；

translations.text: Zheng and Wei sounds are the sounds of chaotic ages, comparable to laxity.

sentences.zh: 角亂則憂，其民怨；

translations.text: Sounds from the Mulberry Interval and above Pu are the sounds of fallen states: their governance scattered, their people flowing away, deceiving superiors while practicing private schemes that cannot be stopped.

sentences.zh: 徵亂則哀，其事勤；

translations.text: When zhi is disordered, it becomes mournful—its affairs laborious;

sentences.zh: 羽亂則危，其財匱。

translations.text: When yu is disordered, it becomes dangerous—its wealth depleted.

sentences.zh: 五者皆亂，迭相陵，謂之慢。

translations.text: When all five are disordered, mutually encroaching, it is called laxity.

sentences.zh: 如此則國之滅亡無日矣。

translations.text: Thus the state's extinction comes without warning.

sentences.zh: 鄭衛之音，亂世之音也，比於慢矣。

translations.text: Zheng and Wei sounds are the sounds of chaotic ages, comparable to laxity.

sentences.zh: 桑閒濮上之音，亡國之音也，其政散，其民流，誣上行私而不可止。

translations.text: Sounds from the Mulberry Interval and above Pu are the sounds of fallen states: their governance scattered, their people flowing away, deceiving superiors while practicing private schemes that cannot be stopped.

All sounds are what are born from human heart. Emotion moves within, thus takes form in sound, sound forms pattern called tone. Thus well-governed age's sound peaceful with joy, its correctness harmonious; Chaotic age's sound resentful with anger, its correctness contrary; Perished state's sound mournful with thought, its people distressed. Sound's way connects with correctness. Gong for ruler, shang for minister, jue for people, zhi for affairs, yu for things. Five not chaotic, then no melancholic sound. Gong chaotic then wild, its ruler arrogant; Shang chaotic then harsh, its ministers ruined; Jue chaotic then worried, its people resentful; Zhi chaotic then mournful, its affairs laborious; Yu chaotic then dangerous, its wealth depleted. Five all chaotic, mutually encroaching, called lax. Thus then state's extinction without day. Zheng Wei sounds are chaotic age's sounds, compare to lax. Mulberry interval Pu above sounds are perished state's sounds, their governance scattered, their people flowing, deceiving superiors practicing private cannot stop.

sentences.zh: 凡音者，生於人心者也；

translations.text: All sounds originate from the human heart;

sentences.zh: 樂者，通於倫理者也。

translations.text: Music connects with the categories and principles of human relationships.

sentences.zh: 是故知聲而不知音者，禽獸是也；

translations.text: Thus those who know sound but not tone are like birds and beasts;

sentences.zh: 知音而不知樂者，眾庶是也。

translations.text: Those who know tone but not music are like the common people.

sentences.zh: 唯君子為能知樂。

translations.text: Only the gentleman can truly know music.

sentences.zh: 是故審聲以知音，審音以知樂，審樂以知政，而治道備矣。

translations.text: Thus one examines sound to understand tone, examines tone to understand music, examines music to understand governance—then the way of governance is complete.

sentences.zh: 是故不知聲者不可與言音，不知音者不可與言樂知樂則幾於禮矣。

translations.text: Thus those who do not know sound cannot discuss tone with them, those who do not know tone cannot discuss music with them. Those who know music approach an understanding of ritual.

sentences.zh: 禮樂皆得，謂之有德。

translations.text: When both ritual and music are obtained, this is called having virtue.

sentences.zh: 德者得也。

translations.text: Virtue means obtaining what is right.

sentences.zh: 是故樂之隆，非極音也；

translations.text: Thus music's flourishing does not mean extreme sounds;

sentences.zh: 食饗之禮，非極味也。

translations.text: Ritual feasting does not mean extreme flavors.

sentences.zh: 清廟之瑟，朱弦而疏越，一倡而三嘆，有遺音者矣。

translations.text: The zither in the Pure Temple has cinnabar-red strings and sparse bridges. One begins the chant, three respond with sighs—here are lingering sounds.

sentences.zh: 大饗之禮，尚玄酒而俎腥魚，大羹不和，有遺味者矣。

translations.text: The great feast ritual honors dark wine, stands hold raw fish, and great broth is not mixed—here are lingering flavors.

sentences.zh: 是故先王之制禮樂也，非以極口腹耳目之欲也，將以教民平好惡而反人道之正也。

translations.text: Thus the former kings, in formulating ritual and music, did not seek to exhaust the desires of mouths, bellies, ears, eyes, and bodies. Rather, they sought to teach people to balance their likes and dislikes, and return to the correct way of humanity.

All sounds born from human heart; Music connects to categories principles. Thus knowing sound but not knowing tone are birds beasts; Knowing tone but not knowing music are common people. Only gentleman can know music. Thus examine sound to know tone, examine tone to know music, examine music to know governance, then governance way complete. Thus not knowing sound cannot speak tone with, not knowing tone cannot speak music with knowing music then approaches ritual. Ritual music both obtained, called having virtue. Virtue is obtaining. Thus music's flourishing not extreme sound; Feasting ritual not extreme flavor. Pure temple's zither, cinnabar strings sparse bridges, one chant three sighs, has remaining sound. Great feast ritual, honors dark wine stands raw fish, great broth not mixed, has remaining flavor. Thus former kings' formulating ritual music, not to exhaust mouth belly ears eyes desires, will teach people balance likes dislikes return human way's correctness.

sentences.zh: 人生而靜，天之性也；

translations.text: Human beings are born quiet—this is Heaven's nature;

sentences.zh: 感於物而動，性之頌也。

translations.text: Being affected by external things and moving—this is human endowment.

sentences.zh: 物至知知，然後好惡形焉。

translations.text: When things arrive, knowledge knows them, and only then do likes and dislikes take form.

sentences.zh: 好惡無節於內，知誘於外，不能反己，天理滅矣。

translations.text: When likes and dislikes have no measure within, and knowledge is lured by externals, one cannot return to the self—Heaven's principle is extinguished.

sentences.zh: 夫物之感人無窮，而人之好惡無節，則是物至而人化物也。

translations.text: When external things affect people without limit, and people's likes and dislikes have no measure, then things arrive and people transform to follow things.

sentences.zh: 人化物也者，滅天理而窮人欲者也。

translations.text: When people transform to follow things, Heaven's principle is extinguished and human desires exhaust themselves.

sentences.zh: 於是有悖逆詐偽之心，有淫佚作亂之事。

translations.text: Thus arise perverse rebellious hearts, fraudulent false thoughts, licentious dissipated actions, and rebellious disorders.

sentences.zh: 是故彊者脅弱，眾者暴寡，知者詐愚，勇者苦怯，疾病不養，老幼孤寡不得其所，此大亂之道也。

translations.text: Thus the strong coerce the weak, the many bully the few, the knowledgeable deceive the ignorant, the brave oppress the cowardly; the sick are not nurtured, the old, young, orphans, and widows do not get their proper place—this is the way of great chaos.

sentences.zh: 是故先王制禮樂，人為之節：衰麻哭泣，所以節喪紀也；

translations.text: Thus the former kings formulated ritual and music to provide measures for people: hemp mourning garments and weeping—these measure mourning rituals;

sentences.zh: 鐘鼓干戚，所以和安樂也；

translations.text: Bells, drums, shields, and axes—these harmonize peaceful joys;

sentences.zh: 婚姻冠笄，所以別男女也；

translations.text: Marriage ceremonies and capping ceremonies—these distinguish male and female;

sentences.zh: 射鄉食饗，所以正交接也。

translations.text: Archery rituals and feasting ceremonies—these correct social intercourse.

sentences.zh: 禮節民心，樂和民聲，政以行之，刑以防之。

translations.text: Ritual regulates people's hearts, music harmonizes people's voices, governance implements them, punishments guard against them.

sentences.zh: 禮樂刑政四達而不悖，則王道備矣。

translations.text: Ritual, music, punishments, and governance—the four reach without contradiction, then the way of the king is complete.

Human born quiet, heaven's nature; Affected by things move, nature's endowment. Things arrive knowledge knows, then likes dislikes take form. Likes dislikes without measure within, knowledge lured without, cannot return self, heaven principle extinguished. Things affecting people without limit, people's likes dislikes without measure, then things arrive people transform to things. People transform to things, extinguish heaven principle exhaust human desires. Thus have perverse rebellious fraudulent false hearts, have licentious dissipated rebellious matters. Thus strong coerce weak, many bully few, knowledgeable deceive ignorant, brave oppress cowardly, sick not nurtured, old young orphans widows not get their place, this great chaos way. Thus former kings formulated ritual music, people make measure: mourning hemp weeping, what measures mourning records; Bells drums shields axes, what harmonize peaceful joy; Marriage and capping ceremonies, these to distinguish male and female; Archery at village, eating feasts, these to correct intercourse. Ritual regulates people's hearts, music harmonizes people's sounds, governance implements it, punishments guard it. Ritual music punishments governance four reach without contradiction, then the kingly way is complete.

sentences.zh: 樂者為同，禮者為異。

translations.text: Music is for uniting what is the same, ritual is for distinguishing what is different.

sentences.zh: 同則相親，異則相敬。

translations.text: What is the same then mutually draws close, what is different then mutually respects.

sentences.zh: 樂勝則流，禮勝則離。

translations.text: When music prevails it becomes licentious, when ritual prevails it becomes distant.

sentences.zh: 合情飾貌者，禮樂之事也。

translations.text: Combining emotion and adorning appearance—these are the matters of ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 禮義立，則貴賤等矣；

translations.text: When ritual righteousness is established, noble and base have their ranks;

sentences.zh: 樂文同，則上下和矣；

translations.text: When music culture is the same, high and low are harmonious;

sentences.zh: 好惡著，則賢不肖別矣；

translations.text: When likes and dislikes are manifest, worthy and unworthy are distinguished;

sentences.zh: 刑禁暴，爵舉賢，則政均矣。

translations.text: When punishments prohibit violence and titles promote the worthy, governance is equal.

sentences.zh: 仁以愛之，義以正之，如此則民治行矣。

translations.text: Benevolence loves them, righteousness corrects them—thus the people proceed in orderly fashion.

Music is for sameness, ritual is for difference. Same then mutually close, different then mutually respectful. Music prevails then flows, ritual prevails then separates. Combining emotion adorning appearance—these are ritual and music's matters. Ritual righteousness established, then noble base have ranks; Music culture same, then high low harmonious; Likes dislikes manifest, then worthy unworthy distinguished; Punishments prohibit violence, titles promote worthy, then governance equal. Benevolence to love them, righteousness to correct them, thus then people orderly proceed.

sentences.zh: 樂由中出，禮自外作。

translations.text: Music issues from within, ritual is made from without.

sentences.zh: 樂由中出，故靜；

translations.text: Music issues from within, thus it is quiet;

sentences.zh: 禮自外作，故文。

translations.text: Ritual is made from without, thus it is patterned.

sentences.zh: 大樂必易，大禮必簡。

translations.text: Great music must be easy, great ritual must be simple.

sentences.zh: 樂至則無怨，禮至則不爭。

translations.text: When music reaches its goal, there is no resentment; when ritual reaches its goal, there is no contention.

sentences.zh: 揖讓而治天下者，禮樂之謂也。

translations.text: Yielding and declining to govern the world—these are what is called ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 暴民不作，諸侯賓服，兵革不試，五刑不用，百姓無患，天子不怒，如此則樂達矣。

translations.text: When violent people do not arise, nobles submit as guests, weapons are not tested, the five punishments are not used, the common people have no worries, the Son of Heaven has no anger—thus music reaches its complete expression.

sentences.zh: 合父子之親，明長幼之序，以敬四海之內。

translations.text: It unites father-son closeness, clarifies elder-younger order, to respect all within the four seas.

sentences.zh: 天子如此，則禮行矣。

translations.text: When the Son of Heaven does this, then ritual proceeds properly.

Music comes from within, ritual made from without. Music comes from within, thus quiet; Ritual made from without, thus patterned. Great music must be easy, great ritual must be simple. Music reaches then no resentment, ritual reaches then no contention. Yielding and declining govern the world—these are called ritual and music. Violent people do not arise, nobles become guests and submit, weapons not tested, five punishments not used, common people without worry, Son of Heaven not angry, thus then music reaches completion. Unites father son closeness, clarifies elder younger order, to respect within the four seas. Son of Heaven thus, then ritual proceeds.

sentences.zh: 大樂與天地同和，大禮與天地同節。

translations.text: Great music harmonizes with heaven and earth, great ritual measures with heaven and earth.

sentences.zh: 和，故百物不失；

translations.text: Harmony—thus the ten thousand things are not lost;

sentences.zh: 節，故祀天祭地。

translations.text: Measure—thus one sacrifices to heaven and worships earth.

sentences.zh: 明則有禮樂，幽則有鬼神，如此則四海之內合敬同愛矣。

translations.text: When bright, there is ritual and music; when dark, there are ghosts and spirits—thus all within the four seas unite in respect and share love.

sentences.zh: 禮者，殊事合敬者也；

translations.text: Ritual unites different matters in respect;

sentences.zh: 樂者，異文合愛者也。

translations.text: Music unites different patterns in love.

sentences.zh: 禮樂之情同，故明王以相沿也。

translations.text: Ritual and music share the same emotion, thus enlightened kings follow one another.

sentences.zh: 故事與時并，名與功偕。

translations.text: Thus matters continue with time, names accompany merit.

sentences.zh: 故鐘鼓管磬羽籥干戚，樂之器也；

translations.text: Thus bells, drums, pipes, chimes, feathers, flutes, shields, and axes are music's instruments;

sentences.zh: 詘信俯仰級兆舒疾，樂之文也。

translations.text: Bending, stretching, bowing, rising, stepping, pausing, slowing, and quickening are music's patterns.

sentences.zh: 簠簋俎豆制度文章，禮之器也；

translations.text: Fu vessels, gui vessels, zu stands, dou vessels, systems, and patterns are ritual's instruments;

sentences.zh: 升降上下周旋裼襲，禮之文也。

translations.text: Ascending, descending, high, low, turning, halting, baring arms, and covering them are ritual's patterns.

sentences.zh: 故知禮樂之情者能作，識禮樂之文者能術。

translations.text: Thus one who knows ritual and music's emotion can compose, one who recognizes ritual and music's patterns can arrange.

sentences.zh: 作者之謂聖，術者之謂明。

translations.text: The composer is called sage, the arranger is called enlightened.

sentences.zh: 明聖者，術作之謂也。

translations.text: Enlightened sage—the arranger and composer are thus called.

Great music with heaven earth same harmony, great ritual with heaven earth same measure. Harmony, thus hundred things not lost; Measure, thus sacrifice heaven worship earth. Bright then has ritual music, dark then has ghosts spirits, thus within four seas united respect same love. Ritual is different matters unite respect; Music is different patterns unite love. Ritual music's emotion same, thus enlightened kings mutually follow. Thus matters with time together, names with merit accompany. Thus bells drums pipes chimes feathers flutes shields axes, music's instruments; Bend stretch bow rise step marks slow fast, music's patterns. Fu gui zu dou systems patterns, ritual's instruments; Ascend descend high low turn about bare clothed, ritual's patterns. Thus knowing ritual music's emotion can compose, recognizing ritual music's patterns can arrange. Composer called sage, arranger called enlightened. Enlightened sage is arranger composer called.

sentences.zh: 樂者，天地之和也；

translations.text: Music is heaven and earth's harmony;

sentences.zh: 禮者，天地之序也。

translations.text: Ritual is heaven and earth's order.

sentences.zh: 和，故百物皆化；

translations.text: Harmony—thus the ten thousand things all transform;

sentences.zh: 序，故群物皆別。

translations.text: Order—thus the various groups are all distinguished.

sentences.zh: 樂由天作，禮以地制。

translations.text: Music is made by heaven, ritual is formulated by earth.

sentences.zh: 過制則亂，過作則暴。

translations.text: Exceeding formulation becomes chaotic, exceeding making becomes violent.

sentences.zh: 明於天地，然後能興禮樂也。

translations.text: When clear about heaven and earth, then one can flourish ritual and music.

sentences.zh: 論倫無患，樂之情也；

translations.text: Discussing categories without worry—this is music's emotion;

sentences.zh: 欣喜驩愛，樂之（容）［官］也。

translations.text: Joyful, happy, loving—this is music's appearance;

sentences.zh: 中正無邪，禮之質也；

translations.text: Central, correct, without deviation—this is ritual's substance;

sentences.zh: 莊敬恭順，禮之制也。

translations.text: Solemn, respectful, reverent, compliant—this is ritual's formulation.

sentences.zh: 若夫禮樂之施於金石，越於聲音，用於宗廟社稷，事于山川鬼神，則此所以與民同也。

translations.text: As for the application of ritual and music to metal and stone, surpassing in sounds, used at ancestral temples and altars, matters at mountains and rivers, ghosts and spirits—thus it unites with the people.

Music is heaven earth's harmony; Ritual is heaven earth's order. Harmony, thus hundred things all transform; Order, thus group things all distinguished. Music by heaven made, ritual by earth formulated. Exceed formulation then chaotic, exceed making then violent. Clear about heaven earth, then able to flourish ritual music. Discussing categories without worry, music's emotion; Joyful happy loving, music's appearance; Central correct without deviation, ritual's substance; Solemn respectful reverent compliant, ritual's formulation. As for ritual music's application to metal stone, surpassing in sounds, used at ancestral temples altars, matters at mountains rivers ghosts spirits, then this is what unites with people.

sentences.zh: 王者功成作樂，治定制禮。

translations.text: When kings achieve merit and make music, when governance is settled and ritual is formulated.

sentences.zh: 其功大者其樂備，其治辨者其禮具。

translations.text: When merit is great, music is complete; when governance is clear, ritual is complete.

sentences.zh: 干戚之舞，非備樂也；

translations.text: Shield and axe dances are not complete music;

sentences.zh: 亨孰而祀，非達禮也。

translations.text: Cooking and sacrificing is not the full expression of ritual.

sentences.zh: 五帝殊時，不相沿樂；

translations.text: The five emperors had different times, not following each other's music;

sentences.zh: 三王異世，不相襲禮。

translations.text: The three kings had different ages, not copying each other's ritual.

sentences.zh: 樂極則憂，禮粗則偏矣。

translations.text: When music is extreme it leads to worry, when ritual is coarse it leads to bias.

sentences.zh: 及夫敦樂而無憂，禮備而不偏者，其唯大聖乎？

translations.text: To reach music that is abundant without worry, ritual that is complete without bias—perhaps only the great sage can do this?

sentences.zh: 天高地下，萬物散殊，而禮制行也；

translations.text: Heaven is high, earth is low, the ten thousand things are scattered and distinct, yet ritual's system proceeds;

sentences.zh: 流而不息，合同而化，而樂興也。

translations.text: Flowing without cessation, uniting and transforming—thus music arises.

sentences.zh: 春作夏長，仁也；

translations.text: Spring works, summer grows—this is benevolence;

sentences.zh: 秋斂冬藏，義也。

translations.text: Autumn gathers, winter stores—this is righteousness.

sentences.zh: 仁近於樂，義近於禮。

translations.text: Benevolence is close to music, righteousness is close to ritual.

sentences.zh: 樂者敦和，率神而從天；

translations.text: Music with thick harmony leads spirits and follows heaven;

sentences.zh: 禮者辨宜，居鬼而從地。

translations.text: Ritual distinguishes what is proper, resides with ghosts and follows earth.

sentences.zh: 故聖人作樂以應天，作禮以配地。

translations.text: Thus sages make music to respond to heaven, make ritual to match earth.

sentences.zh: 禮樂明備，天地官矣。

translations.text: Ritual and music are clearly complete, heaven and earth are officiated.

Kings merit complete make music, governance settled formulate ritual. Merit great then music complete, governance clear then ritual complete. Shields axes dance not complete music; Cook sacrifice not reach ritual. Five emperors different times, not follow music; Three kings different ages, not copy ritual. Music extreme then worry, ritual coarse then biased. Reach thick music without worry, ritual complete without bias, perhaps only great sage? Heaven high earth low, ten thousand things scattered distinct, ritual system proceeds; Flowing without stopping, uniting transforming, music arises. Spring works summer grows, benevolence; Autumn gathers winter stores, righteousness. Benevolence close to music, righteousness close to ritual. Music thick harmony, leads spirits follows heaven; Ritual distinguishes proper, resides ghosts follows earth. Thus sage makes music to respond heaven, makes ritual to match earth. Ritual music clear complete, heaven earth official.

sentences.zh: 天尊地卑，君臣定矣。

translations.text: Heaven is honored, earth is lowly, ruler and minister are settled.

sentences.zh: 高卑已陳，貴賤位矣。

translations.text: High and low are already displayed, noble and base are positioned.

sentences.zh: 動靜有常，小大殊矣。

translations.text: Movement and stillness have constants, small and large are distinct.

sentences.zh: 方以類聚，物以群分，則性命不同矣。

translations.text: Square forms gather by category, things divide by group, thus life natures are different.

sentences.zh: 在天成象，在地成形，如此則禮者天地之別也。

translations.text: In heaven forming images, on earth forming shapes—thus ritual is heaven and earth's distinction.

sentences.zh: 地氣上隮，天氣下降，陰陽相摩，天地相蕩，鼓之以雷霆，奮之以風雨，動之以四時，煖之以日月，而百［物］化興焉，如此則樂者天地之和也。

translations.text: Earth qi rises upward, heaven qi descends downward, yin and yang mutually rub, heaven and earth mutually surge; drumming with thunder, rousing with wind and rain, moving with the four seasons, warming with sun and moon—thus the ten thousand things' transformation and flourishing arise; thus music is heaven and earth's harmony.

Heaven honored earth lowly, ruler minister settled. High low already displayed, noble base positioned. Movement stillness constant, small large distinct. Square by category gathers, things by group divides, then life nature different. In heaven forms image, on earth forms shape, thus ritual heaven earth's distinction. Earth qi upward rises, heaven qi downward descends, yin yang mutually rub, heaven earth mutually surge, drum with thunder, rouse with wind rain, move with four seasons, warm with sun moon, hundred things transformation arises, thus music heaven earth's harmony.

sentences.zh: 化不時則不生，男女無別則亂登，此天地之情也。

translations.text: When transformation is not timely, things do not come into being; when male and female have no distinction, chaotic ascension occurs—this is heaven and earth's emotion.

sentences.zh: 及夫禮樂之極乎天而蟠乎地，行乎陰陽而通乎鬼神，窮高極遠而測深厚，樂著太始而禮居成物。

translations.text: Reaching ritual and music's extreme, coiling with heaven, spreading over earth, proceeding through yin and yang, connecting with ghosts and spirits; exhausting high and extreme, far and measuring, deep and thick—music manifests the great beginning, ritual resides in completed things.

sentences.zh: 著不息者天也，著不動者地也。

translations.text: Manifesting what does not cease is heaven, manifesting what does not move is earth.

sentences.zh: 一動一靜者，天地之閒也。

translations.text: One moving, one still—heaven and earth's interval.

sentences.zh: 故聖人曰「禮云樂云」。

translations.text: Thus the sage says: 'Ritual! Music!'

Transformation not timely then not born, male female no distinction then chaotic ascension, this heaven earth's emotion. Reach ritual music's extreme heaven coil earth, proceed yin yang connect ghosts spirits, exhaust high extreme far measure deep thick, music manifests great beginning ritual resides complete things. Manifest not stopping heaven, manifest not moving earth. One moving one still, heaven earth's between. Thus sage says 'ritual ah music ah'.

sentences.zh: 昔者舜作五弦之琴，以歌南風；

translations.text: Formerly Shun made a five-stringed zither, sang 'Southern Wind';

sentences.zh: 夔始作樂，以賞諸侯。

translations.text: Kui began making music, to reward the nobles.

sentences.zh: 故天子之為樂也，以賞諸侯之有德者也。

translations.text: Thus the Son of Heaven makes music to reward nobles who have virtue.

sentences.zh: 德盛而教尊，五穀時孰，然後賞之以樂。

translations.text: When virtue flourishes and teaching is honored, the five grains ripen in season—then reward with music.

sentences.zh: 故其治民勞者，其舞行級遠；

translations.text: Thus when governing makes people toil, the dance rows and steps are far;

sentences.zh: 其治民佚者，其舞行級短。

translations.text: When governing makes people at ease, the dance rows and steps are short.

sentences.zh: 故觀其舞而知其德，聞其謚而知其行。

translations.text: Thus observe the dance to know virtue, hear the posthumous titles to know conduct.

sentences.zh: 大章，章之也；

translations.text: Great Chapter—chapter it;

sentences.zh: 咸池，備也；

translations.text: Xian Pond—complete it;

sentences.zh: 韶，繼也；

translations.text: Shao—continue it;

sentences.zh: 夏，大也；

translations.text: Xia—great it;

sentences.zh: 殷周之樂盡也。

translations.text: Yin and Zhou's music are exhausted.

Formerly Shun made five string zither, sang southern wind; Kui began making music, to reward nobles. Thus Son of Heaven makes music, to reward nobles having virtue. Virtue flourishing teaching honored, five grains timely ripe, then reward with music. Thus governing people laborious, dance rows step far; Governing people leisurely, dance rows step short. Thus observe dance know virtue, hear posthumous know conduct. Great chapter, chapter it; Xian chi, complete; Shao, continue; Xia, great; Yin Zhou music exhausted.

sentences.zh: 天地之道，寒暑不時則疾，風雨不節則饑。

translations.text: Heaven and earth's way: when cold and heat are not timely, illness arises; when wind and rain are not measured, famine arises.

sentences.zh: 教者，民之寒暑也，教不時則傷世。

translations.text: Teaching is people's cold and heat; when teaching is not timely, it harms the age.

sentences.zh: 事者，民之風雨也，事不節則無功。

translations.text: Matters are people's wind and rain; when matters are not measured, no merit is achieved.

sentences.zh: 然則先王之為樂也，以法治也，善則行象德矣。

translations.text: Thus the former kings made music with governance as the standard: when good, proceed to imitate virtue.

sentences.zh: 夫豢豕為酒，非以為禍也；

translations.text: Fattening pigs to make wine is not done to cause calamity;

sentences.zh: 而獄訟益煩，則酒之流生禍也。

translations.text: Yet when lawsuits increasingly frequent, then wine's flow produces calamity.

sentences.zh: 是故先王因為酒禮，一獻之禮，賓主百拜，終日飲酒而不得醉焉，此先王之所以備酒禍也。

translations.text: Thus the former kings established wine rituals: the ritual of one offering, with guest and host making a hundred bows, drinking all day without becoming drunk—this is how the former kings guarded against wine's calamity.

sentences.zh: 故酒食者，所以合歡也。

translations.text: Thus wine and food serve to unite joys.

Heaven earth's way, cold heat not timely then illness, wind rain not measured then famine. Teaching people's cold heat, teaching not timely then harm age. Matters people's wind rain, matters not measured then no merit. Thus former kings made music, with law govern, good then proceed imitate virtue. Fatten pig make wine, not for calamity; Lawsuits increasingly frequent, then wine's flow produces calamity. Thus former kings because wine ritual, one offering ritual, guest host hundred bows, all day drink wine not get drunk, this former kings' preparing wine calamity. Thus wine food what unites joy.

sentences.zh: 樂者，所以象德也；

translations.text: Music serves to imitate virtue;

sentences.zh: 禮者，所以閉淫也。

translations.text: Ritual serves to close licentiousness.

sentences.zh: 是故先王有大事，必有禮以哀之；

translations.text: Thus the former kings had great matters, and must have ritual to mourn them;

sentences.zh: 有大福，必有禮以樂之：哀樂之分，皆以禮終。

translations.text: They had great blessings, and must have ritual to delight in them. Mourning and delight's division—all end with ritual.

Music what imitates virtue; Ritual is what closes licentiousness. Thus former kings had great matters, must have ritual to grieve them; Had great blessings, must have ritual to delight them: grief delight's division, all end with ritual.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，施也；

translations.text: Music is application;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，報也。

translations.text: Ritual is response.

sentences.zh: 樂，樂其所自生；

translations.text: Music delights in what it itself produces;

sentences.zh: 而禮，反其所自始。

translations.text: Ritual returns to what it itself began.

sentences.zh: 樂章德，禮報情反始也。

translations.text: Music displays virtue, ritual responds to emotion and returns to beginnings.

sentences.zh: 所謂大路者，天子之輿也；

translations.text: What is called the Great Road is the Son of Heaven's carriage;

sentences.zh: 龍旂九旒，天子之旌也；

translations.text: The dragon banner with nine streamers is the Son of Heaven's banner;

sentences.zh: 青黑緣者，天子之葆龜也；

translations.text: The blue-black bordered canopy and tortoise chariot are the Son of Heaven's emblems;

sentences.zh: 從之以牛羊之群，則所以贈諸侯也。

translations.text: Followed by herds of oxen and sheep—thus it is presented to the nobles.

Music is application; Ritual is response. Music delights what it self produces; Ritual returns to what it self began. Music displays virtue, ritual responds to emotion returns to beginning. What is called great road is Son of Heaven's carriage; Dragon banner nine streamers, Son of Heaven's banner; Blue black bordered, Son of Heaven's canopy tortoise; Followed by herds of oxen sheep, then this is to present to nobles.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，情之不可變者也；

translations.text: Music is emotion that cannot be changed;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，理之不可易者也。

translations.text: Ritual is principle that cannot be altered.

sentences.zh: 樂統同，禮別異，禮樂之說貫乎人情矣。

translations.text: Music unites what is the same, ritual distinguishes what is different—ritual and music's explanation penetrates human emotion.

sentences.zh: 窮本知變，樂之情也；

translations.text: Exhaust the source to know change—this is music's emotion;

sentences.zh: 著誠去偽，禮之經也。

translations.text: Manifest sincerity, remove falsity—this is ritual's canon.

sentences.zh: 禮樂順天地之誠，達神明之德，降興上下之神，而凝是精粗之體，領父子君臣之節。

translations.text: Ritual and music follow heaven and earth's sincerity, reach the spirits' virtue, descend and raise the high and low spirits, condense the fine and coarse bodies, lead the sections of father, son, ruler, and minister.

Music is emotion that cannot be changed; Ritual is principle that cannot be altered. Music unites same, ritual distinguishes different, ritual music's explanation penetrates human emotion. Exhaust source know change, music's emotion; Manifest sincerity remove falsity, ritual's canon. Ritual music follows heaven earth's sincerity, reaches spirits' virtue, descends raises high low spirits, condenses fine coarse bodies, leads father son ruler minister sections.

sentences.zh: 是故大人舉禮樂，則天地將為昭焉。

translations.text: Thus when great men raise ritual and music, heaven and earth will illuminate.

sentences.zh: 天地欣合，陰陽相得，煦嫗覆育萬物，然後草木茂，區萌達，羽翮奮，角觡生，蟄蟲昭穌，羽者嫗伏，毛者孕鬻，胎生者不殰而卵生者不殈，則樂之道歸焉耳。

translations.text: Heaven and earth unite in joy, yin and yang mutually obtain, warming and brooding to cover and nurture the ten thousand things; then grass and trees flourish, district sprouts reach, winged creatures exert their wings, horned creatures grow their antlers, hibernating insects clearly revive, feathered ones brood and lie, furred ones become pregnant and nourish, womb-born do not abort, egg-born do not break—thus music's way returns there.

Thus great man raises ritual music, then heaven earth will illuminate. Heaven earth joyful unite, yin yang mutually obtain, warm brood cover nurture ten thousand things, then grass wood flourish, district sprouts reach, feathers wings exert, horns antlers grow, hibernating insects clearly revive, feathered ones brood lie, furred ones pregnant nourish, womb born not abort and egg born not break, then music's way returns there.

sentences.zh: 樂者，非謂黃鐘大呂弦歌干揚也，樂之末節也，故童者舞之；

translations.text: Music does not mean yellow bells, great lü, string songs, shield lifting—these are music's minor sections, thus children dance to them;

sentences.zh: 布筵席，陳樽俎，列籩豆，以升降為禮者，禮之末節也，故有司掌之。

translations.text: Spreading mats and seats, arranging pitchers and stands, arranging baskets and beans, with ascending and descending as ritual—these are ritual's minor sections, thus officials manage them.

sentences.zh: 樂師辯乎聲詩，故北面而弦；

translations.text: The music master distinguishes sounds and poems, thus faces north and plays strings;

sentences.zh: 宗祝辯乎宗廟之禮，故後尸；

translations.text: The ancestral priest distinguishes ancestral temple rituals, thus stands behind the corpse;

sentences.zh: 商祝辯乎喪禮，故後主人。

translations.text: The funeral priest distinguishes mourning rituals, thus stands behind the master.

sentences.zh: 是故德成而上，藝成而下；

translations.text: Thus virtue when complete is above, arts when complete are below;

sentences.zh: 行成而先，事成而後。

translations.text: Conduct when complete is first, matters when complete are after.

sentences.zh: 是故先王有上有下，有先有後，然後可以有制於天下也。

translations.text: Thus the former kings had above and below, had first and after—then they could establish regulation over the world.

Music is not meaning yellow bell great lü string songs shield lift—these are music's minor sections, thus children dance them; Spread mats seats, arrange pitchers stands, arrange baskets beans, with ascending descending as ritual—these are ritual's minor sections, thus officials manage them. Music master distinguishes sounds poems, thus north facing strings; Ancestral priest distinguishes ancestral temple ritual, thus behind corpse; Funeral priest distinguishes mourning ritual, thus behind master. Thus virtue complete then above, arts complete then below; Conduct complete then first, matters complete then after. Thus former kings had above below, had first after, then can have regulation over the world.

sentences.zh: 樂者，聖人之所樂也，而可以善民心。

translations.text: Music is what sages delight in, and can improve people's hearts.

sentences.zh: 其感人深，其風移俗易，故先王著其教焉。

translations.text: Its influence is deep, its wind shifts customs with ease—thus former kings established their teachings.
Music is what sages delight in, and can improve people's hearts. Its affecting people deep, its wind shifts customs easily, thus former kings established their teaching.

sentences.zh: 夫人有血氣心知之性，而無哀樂喜怒之常，應感起物而動，然後心術形焉。

translations.text: Man has blood and qi, heart and knowing nature, without the constants of grief, joy, anger, and happiness. Responding to stimuli, they arise from things and move—then the heart's methods take form.

sentences.zh: 是故志微焦衰之音作，而民思憂；

translations.text: Thus subtle worried declining sounds arise, and people think of sorrow;

sentences.zh: 啴緩慢易繁文簡節之音作，而民康樂；

translations.text: Broad relaxed slow easy ornate simple sounds arise, and people are peaceful and happy;

sentences.zh: 粗厲猛起奮末廣賁之音作，而民剛毅；

translations.text: Coarse fierce vigorous rising exerting end broad flourishing sounds arise, and people are firm and resolute;

sentences.zh: 廉直經正莊誠之音作，而民肅敬；

translations.text: Upright straight regular correct solemn sincere sounds arise, and people are solemn and respectful;

sentences.zh: 寬裕肉好順成和動之音作，而民慈愛；

translations.text: Broad generous flesh good compliant complete harmonious moving sounds arise, and people are benevolent and loving;

sentences.zh: 流辟邪散狄成滌濫之音作，而民淫亂。

translations.text: Flowing deviant evil scattered isolated complete washed overflowing sounds arise, and people are licentious and chaotic.

Man has blood qi heart knowing nature, without grief joy anger happiness constants, responding to stimulation arises from things and moves, then heart methods take form. Thus subtle worried declining sounds made, people think worry; Broad relaxed slow easy ornate simple sounds made, people peaceful happy; Coarse fierce vigorous rising exerting end broad flourishing sounds made, people firm resolute; Upright straight regular correct solemn sincere sounds made, people solemn respectful; Broad generous flesh good compliant complete harmonious moving sounds made, people benevolent loving; Flowing deviant evil scattered isolated complete washed overflowing sounds made, people licentious chaotic.

sentences.zh: 是故先王本之情性，稽之度數，制之禮義，合生氣之和，道五常之行，使之陽而不散，陰而不密，剛氣不怒，柔氣不懾，四暢交於中而發作於外，皆安其位而不相奪也。

translations.text: Thus former kings based on emotion and nature, examined measurements and numbers, formulated ritual and righteousness, combined life qi harmony, guided the five constants' conduct, made them yang without dispersing, yin without dense, firm qi not angry, soft qi not fearful, four flows cross in center and issue outside—all settle their positions without mutually seizing.

sentences.zh: 然後立之學等，廣其節奏，省其文采，以繩德厚也。

translations.text: Then established learning grades, broadened rhythms, reduced patterns, to rope virtue and make it thick.

sentences.zh: 類小大之稱，比終始之序，以象事行，使親疏貴賤長幼男女之理皆形見於樂：故曰「樂觀其深矣」。

translations.text: Compare small and large proportions, match end and beginning order, to resemble matters and conduct—make close and distant, noble and base, elder and young, male and female principles all visibly appear in music. Thus it is said: 'Observe music's depth.'

Thus former kings based on emotion nature, examined measurements numbers, formulated ritual righteousness, combined life qi harmony, guided five constants conduct, made them yang without dispersing, yin without dense, firm qi not angry, soft qi not fearful, four flows cross in center and issue outside, all settle their positions without mutually seizing. Then established learning grades, broadened their rhythms, reduced their patterns, to rope virtue make thick. Compare small large proportions, match end beginning order, to resemble matters conduct, make close distant noble base elder young male female principles all visibly appear in music: thus says 'music observe its deep'.

sentences.zh: 土敝則草木不長，水煩則魚鱉不大，氣衰則生物不育，世亂則禮廢而樂淫。

translations.text: When soil is exhausted, grass and trees do not grow; when water is troubled, fish and turtles do not become large; when qi declines, living things do not flourish; when the age is chaotic, ritual wastes and music becomes licentious.

sentences.zh: 是故其聲哀而不莊，樂而不安，慢易以犯節，流湎以忘本。

translations.text: Thus its sound is mournful without solemnity, happy without calm, lax and easy violating measure, flowing and drowning forgetting the root.

sentences.zh: 廣則容姦。

translations.text: When broad, it contains evil.

sentences.zh: 狹則思欲，感滌蕩之氣而滅平和之德，是以君子賤之也。

translations.text: When narrow, it arouses desires; affected by washed and wandering qi, it extinguishes peaceful virtue—thus gentlemen despise it.

Soil exhausted then grass wood not grow, water troubled then fish turtles not large, qi declining then living things not nurtured, age chaotic then ritual wastes music licentious. Thus its sound grieving without solemnity, happy without calm, lax easy violating measure, flowing drowning forgetting root. Broad then contains evil. Narrow then thinks desires, affected by washed wandering qi extinguishes peaceful virtue, thus gentlemen despise it.

sentences.zh: 凡姦聲感人而逆氣應之，逆氣成象而淫樂興焉。

translations.text: All evil sounds affect people, perverse qi responds, perverse qi forms images, licentious music arises.

sentences.zh: 正聲感人而順氣應之，順氣成象而和樂興焉。

translations.text: Correct sounds affect people, compliant qi responds, compliant qi forms images, harmonious music arises.

sentences.zh: 倡和有應，回邪曲直各歸其分，而萬物之理以類相動也。

translations.text: Lead and harmony have response, crooked and straight each return to their division, the ten thousand things' principle moves by category mutually.

All evil sounds affect people perverse qi responds, perverse qi forms image licentious music arises. Correct sounds affect people compliant qi responds, compliant qi forms image harmonious music arises. Lead harmony have response, return crooked straight each return their division, ten thousand things principle by category mutually move.

sentences.zh: 是故君子反情以和其志，比類以成其行。

translations.text: Thus the gentleman returns emotion to harmonize will, compares categories to complete conduct.

sentences.zh: 姦聲亂色不留聰明，淫樂廢禮不接於心術，惰慢邪辟之氣不設於身體，使耳目鼻口心知百體皆由順正，以行其義。

translations.text: Evil sounds make chaotic colors not remain in clear wisdom, licentious music wastes ritual not connecting to heart methods, lazy lax deviant perverse qi not established in body—make ears, eyes, nose, mouth, heart, knowing, hundred bodies all follow orderly correct, to proceed with righteousness.

sentences.zh: 然後發以聲音，文以琴瑟，動以干戚，飾以羽旄，從以簫管，奮至德之光，動四氣之和，以著萬物之理。

translations.text: Then issue with sounds, pattern with zither and se, move with shields and axes, adorn with feathers and banners, follow with flutes and pipes, arouse great virtue's light, move four qi harmony, manifest ten thousand things' principle.

sentences.zh: 是故清明象天，廣大象地，終始象四時，周旋象風雨；

translations.text: Thus clear brightness imitates heaven, vast greatness imitates earth, end and beginning imitate four seasons, turning imitates wind and rain;

sentences.zh: 五色成文而不亂，八風從律而不姦，百度得數而有常；

translations.text: Five colors form patterns without confusion, eight winds follow pitch without evil, hundred measures get numbers with constant;

sentences.zh: 小大相成，終始相生，倡和清濁，代相為經。

translations.text: Small and large mutually complete, end and beginning mutually produce, lead harmony clear turbid, alternate mutually as pattern.

sentences.zh: 故樂行而倫清，耳目聰明，血氣和平，移風易俗，天下皆寧。

translations.text: Thus music proceeds, categories become clear, ears and eyes gain wisdom, blood and qi become peaceful, shift wind and change customs, all under heaven become peaceful.

sentences.zh: 故曰「樂者樂也」。

translations.text: Thus it is said: 'Music is delight.'

sentences.zh: 君子樂得其道，小人樂得其欲。

translations.text: The gentleman delights in getting the way, the small person delights in getting desires.

sentences.zh: 以道制欲，則樂而不亂；

translations.text: With way controlling desires, then delight without chaos;

sentences.zh: 以欲忘道，則惑而不樂。

translations.text: With desires forgetting way, then confusion without delight.

sentences.zh: 是故君子反情以和其志，廣樂以成其教，樂行而民鄉方，可以觀德矣。

translations.text: Thus the gentleman returns emotion to harmonize will, broadens music to complete teaching, music proceeds and people turn toward direction, can observe virtue.

Thus gentleman returns emotion to harmonize his will, compares categories to complete his conduct. Evil sounds chaotic colors not remain clear wisdom, licentious music wastes ritual not connect to heart methods, lazy lax deviant perverse qi not established in body, make ears eyes nose mouth heart knowing hundred bodies all follow orderly correct, to proceed their righteousness. Then issue with sounds, pattern with zither se, move with shields axes, adorn with feathers banners, follow with flutes pipes, rouse great virtue's light, move four qi harmony, manifest ten thousand things principle. Thus clear bright imitates heaven, vast great imitates earth, end beginning imitates four seasons, turning imitates wind rain; Five colors form pattern not chaotic, eight winds follow pitch not evil, hundred measures get number have constant; Small large mutually complete, end beginning mutually produce, lead harmony clear turbid, alternate mutually as warp. Thus music proceeds categories clear, ears eyes clear wisdom, blood qi peaceful, shift wind change customs, world all peaceful. Thus says 'music is delight'. Gentleman delights get way, small person delights get desires. With way control desires, then delight without chaos; With desires forget way, then confused without delight. Thus gentleman returns emotion harmonizes will, broadens music completes teaching, music proceeds people turn to direction, can observe virtue.

sentences.zh: 德者，性之端也；

translations.text: Virtue is nature's beginning;

sentences.zh: 樂者，德之華也；

translations.text: Music is virtue's flower;

sentences.zh: 金石絲竹，樂之器也。

translations.text: Metal, stone, silk, bamboo—these are music's instruments.

sentences.zh: 詩，言其志也；

translations.text: Poems speak of the will;

sentences.zh: 歌，詠其聲也；

translations.text: Songs chant the voice;

sentences.zh: 舞，動其容也：三者本乎心，然後樂氣從之。

translations.text: Dances move appearances: these three originate from the heart, then music's qi follows.

sentences.zh: 是故情深而文明，氣盛而化神，和順積中而英華發外，唯樂不可以為偽。

translations.text: Thus emotion when deep is patterned and bright, qi when flourishing transforms the spirit, harmonious compliance accumulates in center, brilliant flowers issue outside—only music cannot be false.

Virtue nature's beginning; Music virtue's flower; Metal stone silk bamboo, music's instruments. Poem speaks will; Song chants sound; Dance moves appearance: three base on heart, then music qi follows. Thus emotion deep patterned bright, qi flourishing transforms spirit, harmonious compliant accumulates center brilliant flower issues outside, only music cannot be false.

sentences.zh: 樂者，心之動也；

translations.text: Music is the heart's movement;

sentences.zh: 聲者，樂之象也；

translations.text: Sound is music's image;

sentences.zh: 文采節奏，聲之飾也。

translations.text: Patterns, rhythms—these are sound's adornments.

sentences.zh: 君子動其本，樂其象，然後治其飾。

translations.text: The gentleman moves the root, delights in the image, then governs the adornments.

sentences.zh: 是故先鼓以警戒，三步以見方，再始以著往，復亂以飭歸，奮疾而不拔，（也）極幽而不隱。

translations.text: Thus first drum to alert and caution, three steps to see the square, twice begin to manifest going, repeat chaos to arrange return, arouse fast without pulling out, reach profound without hiding.

sentences.zh: 獨樂其志，不厭其道；

translations.text: Alone delight in the will, not weary of the way;

sentences.zh: 備舉其道，不私其欲。

translations.text: Complete raise the way, not private with desires.

sentences.zh: 是以情見而義立，樂終而德尊；

translations.text: Thus emotion seen, righteousness established, music ended, virtue honored;

sentences.zh: 君子以好善，小人以息過：故曰「生民之道，樂為大焉」。

translations.text: Gentleman with delight in goodness, small person with ceasing errors—thus it is said: 'The living people's way, music is great.'

Music heart's movement; Sound music's image; Patterns rhythms, sound's adornment. Gentleman moves root, delights image, then governs adornment. Thus first drum to alert caution, three steps to see square, twice begin to manifest going, repeat chaos to arrange return, rouse fast not pull out, reach profound not hide. Alone delight will, not weary way; Complete raise way, not private desires. Thus emotion seen righteousness established, music ends virtue honored; Gentleman with like good, small person with rest errors: thus says 'living people way, music great'.

sentences.zh: 君子曰：禮樂不可以斯須去身。

translations.text: The gentleman says: ritual and music cannot be separated from the body for a moment.

sentences.zh: 致樂以治心，則易直子諒之心油然生矣。

translations.text: Apply music to govern the heart, then easy, straight, filial, sincere hearts naturally arise.

sentences.zh: 易直子諒之心生則樂，樂則安，安則久，久則天，天則神。

translations.text: Easy, straight, filial, sincere hearts arise, then delight; delight, then calm; calm, then lasting; lasting, then heaven; heaven, then spirit.

sentences.zh: 天則不言而信，神則不怒而威。

translations.text: Heaven, then not speaking yet trustworthy; spirit, then not angry yet awe-inspiring.

sentences.zh: 致樂，以治心者也；

translations.text: Apply music to govern the heart;

sentences.zh: 致禮，以治躬者也。

translations.text: Apply ritual to govern the person.

sentences.zh: 治躬則莊敬，莊敬則嚴威。

translations.text: Govern the person, then solemn and respectful; solemn and respectful, then strict and awe-inspiring.

sentences.zh: 心中斯須不和不樂，而鄙詐之心入之矣；

translations.text: Heart for a moment not harmonious, not delightful, vulgar deceitful heart enters;

sentences.zh: 外貌斯須不莊不敬，而慢易之心入之矣。

translations.text: Outer appearance for a moment not solemn, not respectful, lax easy heart enters.

sentences.zh: 故樂也者，動於內者也；

translations.text: Thus music moves within;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，動於外者也。

translations.text: Ritual moves without.

sentences.zh: 樂極和，禮極順。

translations.text: Music when extreme is harmony, ritual when extreme is compliance.

sentences.zh: 內和而外順，則民瞻其顏色而弗與爭也，望其容貌而民不生易慢焉。

translations.text: Inner harmony, outer compliance, then people gaze at countenances without contending, look at appearances, people do not give birth to lax disrespect.

sentences.zh: 德煇動乎內而民莫不承聽，理發乎外而民莫不承順，故曰「知禮樂之道，舉而錯之天下無難矣」。

translations.text: Virtue's radiance moves within, people none not accept and listen; principle issues without, people none not accept and comply. Thus it is said: 'Know ritual music's way, raise and apply it, no difficulty in the world.'

Gentleman says: ritual music cannot moment leave body. Apply music to govern heart, then easy straight filial sincere heart naturally born. Easy straight filial sincere heart born then delight, delight then calm, calm then lasting, lasting then heaven, heaven then spirit. Heaven then not speak trustworthy, spirit then not angry awe-inspiring. Apply music to govern heart; Apply ritual to govern person. Govern person then solemn respectful, solemn respectful then strict awe. Heart moment not harmonious not delightful, vulgar deceitful heart enters; Outer appearance moment not solemn not respectful, lax easy heart enters. Thus music moves within; Ritual moves without. Music extreme harmony, ritual extreme compliance. Inner harmony outer compliance, then people gaze face not contend, look appearance people not born lax disrespect. Virtue radiance moves within people none not accept listen, principle issues without people none not accept comply, thus says 'know ritual music way, raise apply world no difficulty'.

sentences.zh: 樂也者，動於內者也；

translations.text: Music moves within;

sentences.zh: 禮也者，動於外者也。

translations.text: Ritual moves without.

sentences.zh: 故禮主其謙，樂主其盈。

translations.text: Thus ritual masters humility, music masters fullness.

sentences.zh: 禮謙而進，以進為文；

translations.text: Ritual humble advances, advances as pattern;

sentences.zh: 樂盈而反，以反為文。

translations.text: Music full returns, returns as pattern.

sentences.zh: 禮謙而不進，則銷；

translations.text: Ritual humble without advancing, then melts;

sentences.zh: 樂盈而不反，則放。

translations.text: Music full without returning, then dissipates.

sentences.zh: 故禮有報而樂有反。

translations.text: Thus ritual has response, music has return.

sentences.zh: 禮得其報則樂，樂得其反則安。

translations.text: Ritual gets response then delights, music gets return then calms.

sentences.zh: 禮之報，樂之反，其義一也。

translations.text: Ritual's response, music's return—their meaning is one.

Music moves within; Ritual moves without. Thus ritual masters humility, music masters fullness. Ritual humble advances, with advance as pattern; Music full returns, with return as pattern. Ritual humble not advance, then melts; Music full not return, then dissipates. Thus ritual has response music has return. Ritual gets response then delight, music gets return then calm. Ritual's response, music's return, their meaning is one.

sentences.zh: 夫樂者樂也，人情之所不能免也。

translations.text: Music is delight, human emotion's inescapable thing.

sentences.zh: 樂必發諸聲音，形於動靜，人道也。

translations.text: Music must issue from sounds, form in movement and stillness, the human way.

sentences.zh: 聲音動靜，性術之變，盡於此矣。

translations.text: Sounds, movement, stillness—nature's method changes, exhausts herein.

sentences.zh: 故人不能無樂，樂不能無形。

translations.text: Thus man cannot be without music, music cannot be without form.

sentences.zh: 形而不為道，不能無亂。

translations.text: Form without guidance, cannot be without chaos.

sentences.zh: 先王惡其亂，故制雅頌之聲以道之，使其聲足以樂而不流，使其文足以綸而不息，使其曲直繁省廉肉節奏，足以感動人之善心而已矣，不使放心邪氣得接焉，是先王立樂之方也。

translations.text: Former kings hated its chaos, thus formulated ya and song sounds to guide it, made sound sufficient to delight without licentiousness, made pattern sufficient to weave without cessation, made straight crooked ornate simple upright fleshy rhythms sufficient to move people's good hearts only, not made carefree evil qi connect—thus former kings established music's method.

sentences.zh: 是故樂在宗廟之中，君臣上下同聽之，則莫不和敬；

translations.text: Thus music in ancestral temple midst, ruler minister high low together listen, none not harmonious respectful;

sentences.zh: 在族長鄉里之中，長幼同聽之，則莫不和順；

translations.text: In clan elder village midst, elder young together listen, none not harmonious compliant;

sentences.zh: 在閨門之內，父子兄弟同聽之，則莫不和親。

translations.text: In inner chambers within, father son brothers together listen, none not harmonious close.

sentences.zh: 故樂者，審一以定和，比物以飾節，節奏合以成文，所以合和父子君臣，附親萬民也，是先王立樂之方也。

translations.text: Thus music examines one to settle harmony, compares things to adorn measure, rhythm combines to form pattern, unites harmony father son ruler minister, attaches closeness myriad people—this is former kings established music's method.

sentences.zh: 故聽其雅頌之聲，志意得廣焉；

translations.text: Thus listen to ya song sounds, will intent broadens;

sentences.zh: 執其干戚，習其俯仰詘信，容貌得莊焉；

translations.text: Hold shields axes, practice bowing rising bending stretching, appearance becomes solemn;

sentences.zh: 行其綴兆，要其節奏，行列得正焉，進退得齊焉。

translations.text: Perform connected marks, grasp rhythms, ranks become correct, advance retreat become orderly.

sentences.zh: 故樂者天地之齊，中和之紀，人情之所不能免也。

translations.text: Thus music is heaven earth's equal, central harmony's record, human emotion's inescapable thing.

Music is delight, human emotion's what cannot be avoided. Music must issue from sounds, take form in movement stillness, human way. Sounds movement stillness, nature method's change, exhausts in this. Thus man cannot without music, music cannot without form. Form without being guided, cannot without chaos.
